abstract.t: Network slicing is an approach to provide separate virtual network based on service requirements. It's a fundamental concept of the 5G and the architecture and specification is under standardization in several organizations. However, the definitions and scopes on network slicing are a bit vary by organization. This document provides classification of provisioning models of network slice for clarifying the differences on the definitions and scopes.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: Network slicing is an approach to provide separate virtual networks depending on requirements of each service. Network slicing receives attention due to factors such as diversity of services and devices, and it is also a fundamental concept of the 5G for applying networks to such various types of requirements.

In addition, network slicing is expected to enable a business model to provide dedicated networks to 3rd parties on-demand, called NSaaS (Network Slice as a Service). For such usage, in network slicing, provision of networks which guarantee communication qualities from end to end would be required. However, the definitions are not authorized over several SDOs (Standards Developing Organizations).
This document clarifies provision patterns of network slice, and provides the definitions and purposes which are available over several organizations.

section.title: Definition of Terms
section.t: This section lists definitions and terminologies related to network slicing. They refer ones of and .

list.t: Network slicing is a technology or an approach to create separate virtual networks in support of services, depending on several requirements, on the same physical resources. This is possible by combinations of several network technologies.

An NS is a virtual network established on network infrastructure. Some include additional network functions such as firewall or load-balancer in addition to basically forwarding functions such as switches or routers. It has an overlay architecture and is independent from the underlay network's topology.
An NS subnet is partially virtual network established within a single domain.
An E2E-NS is a virtual network connecting between end points. E2E slices are composed of a single NS subnet or multiple NS subnets.
An NSaaS is a NS distribution model in which a third-party provider hosts NSs and makes them available to customers.
An NS tenant is a person or group that rents and occupies NSs from NS providers.
A domain is a group of a network and devices administrated as a unit with common rules and procedures.
A resource is element used to create virtual networks. There are several types of resources, i.e., connectivity, computing and storage. The details are described
A virtual network is a network running a number of virtual network functions.

A virtual network function (VNF) is a network function whose functional software is decoupled from hardware. One or more virtual machines running different software and processes on top of industry-standard high-volume servers, switches and storage, or cloud computing infrastructure, and capable of implementing network functions traditionally implemented via custom hardware appliances and middleboxes (e.g., router, NAT, firewall, load balancer, etc.)

section.title: General Requirements for Network Slicing
section.t: On network slice operation, capability of dynamic instantiation, change, and delete would be required because an NS is established based on received order from a tenant. From this aspect, some mechanism to design a network based on service requirements and to convert concrete configurations based on the design would be required.

In addition, each NS has to maintain definite communication quality from end to end, and resource reservations on data plane and isolation among NSs would be required. Isolation is a concept to prevent some reduction of communication quality caused by disturbance from another or other NSs, and it has some levels on the strength, such as hard or soft isolations.
The required promptness of slice operation and granularity of communication quality would vary depending on provisioning model.

section.title: Resources for Structuring Network Slices
section.t: A network slice is structured with combinations of the resources. Such resources are mainly categorized into three patterns: network, server functionality resources. Variations of each resources are described below. (Note that the lists are not exhaustive.)

Virtual/physical links:
Bandwidth per link/session Connected area/end points Forwarding route/path (e.g., for traffic engineering, redundancy) Priority (e.g., QoS class) Session capacity (e.g., the number of connectable devices) Multicast support Metadata conveyance Protocol of virtual link

section.title: Basic Network Slice Structure
section.t:
An E2E-NS is structured by stitching NS subnets instantiated on each domain. (In some case, a single NS subnet is treated as an E2E NS.) Domain types where some sub-NSs are established are described below:
Fix access network Mobile access network Transport network Fix core network Mobile core network Data center (DC)

describes the overview of this structure. Access network, core network, and DC domains provide NS-subnets by combining network/server resources, and an E2E-NS is established by stitching these NS-subnets. Ways to stitch NS-subnets are described in and .

section.title: Players on Structuring Network Slices
section.t:
This sub-section describes players on structuring NSs. On a basic NS structure, an E2E-NS is established by either following players:
One of NS-subnet providers Service provider (user of E2E-NS) Others (e.g., external coordinator)

Also, candidates of players on network slicing are described below:
infrastructure operator
infrastructure operator, coordinator
infrastructure operator, service provider, enterprise, mass user
enterprise, mass user

section.title: Types of Network Slices on Provision to Tenants
section.t: The types of NSs on their provision are mainly categorized into two types: ready-made(RM) NS and custom-made(CM) NS. This section describes the features of these types.

section.title: Ready-made Network Slice
section.t:
An RM-NS is a NS which the infrastructure operator decides requirements and established based on them in advance. A tenant selects one of RM-NSs whose requirements are closer to its requrest. As examples of usages of RM-NSs, the following three types communication is advocated in 3GPP (Ref. ).
NS for URLLC provides low-latency and High reliable communication, and it is expected to be used for services which require real-time control such as connected vehicles.
NS for eMBB provides high-capacity bandwidth communication, and it is expected to be used for services which consume enormous traffic such as VR/AR and high quality video streaming(e.g., 4K/8K).
mIoT NS provides connectivity for massive number of IoT devices such as smart meters.

section.title: Custom-made Network Slice
section.t: A CM-NS is a NS which is established based on an order from an external and provided to it. As examples of usage of CM-NS, an enterprise builds and operate a virtual network for connecting several bases, or OTT (Over The Top) or other industrial service providers use NSs as a part of their own services (e.g., connected vehicles/drones, online video games, or remote surgery).
In this model, network operation system would be required to have intelligence and orchestration function(s) to create the appropriate network on-demand.

section.title: Network Slice Provision Models
section.t: This section describes provision models of NSs on NSaaS.

section.title: Provision Models
section.t:
The provision models are categorized into three models: SaaS (Service as a Service), PaaS (Platform as a Service) like models as below.
In this model, an infrastructure operator designs NS templates in advance, and a tenant selects and uses one which fulfills most its requirement from the templates. The specifications of NSs are abstracted to KPI as networks and servers and shown to tenants. In short, detailed parameters of infrastructure network are hidden from tenant. RM-NS is categorized into this model.
In this model, a tenant offers its request shown with connected area, KPIs, and included service functions, and infrastructure operators designs a template and instantiate an NS based on the request dynamically. The configurable values would vary depending on policy of each NS provider.
In this model, a tenant designs and instantiates NSs by indicating concrete resources to infrastructure operators. In other words, infrastructure operators provide just their resources, and NSs are coordinated by tenant.
Note that, in some cases, an E2E-NS may be established by stitching different types of NS-subnets.
